assumptions.text: Classical mechanics framework: relativistic effects negligible (v << c), quantum effects negligible for macroscopic bodies
Both bodies can be treated as point masses with spherically symmetric mass distributions
Non-relativistic framework where particle velocities are much less than the speed of light
Quantum mechanical effects are negligible for the system under consideration
Observations made from an inertial (non-accelerating) reference frame
Conservation laws (energy, momentum, angular momentum) hold for the system
